newsitem.title: UK: UK shares open firm, lifted by Wall Street advance.
newsitem.headline: UK shares open firm, lifted by Wall Street advance.

text.p: UK blue chips pushed moderately higher on Wednesday following Wall Street's dramatic rise on Tuesday, but trading volumes are expected to remain light as institutional investors stay on the sidelines, dealers said.
"We've had a bit of a mark up but the fund managers still don't want to do too much," the head of trading at a major investment house said.
"There is still too much uncertainty about for the market to go charging forward."
The FTSE 100 index was up 14.9 points to 4,301.7 by 0740 GMT following the Dow's 135-point surge on Tuesday.
